MainHeading.P: The House assembled for private session at 12.30 p.m. on the 22nd January, 1919.
COUNT PLUNKETT took the Chair on the motion of the Deputy for Connemara (P. O MAILLE) seconded by the Deputy for College Green (SEAN T. O'KELLY).

MainHeading.Title: ROLL CALL.
MainHeading.P: The Roll of members was called over by the Clerk and the following teachtai answered to their names:—
Letters and telegrams of congratulation on the Declaration of Independence of the Irish Republic were read.

Mr. T.J. HARBISON, teachta for N.E. Tyrone, wrote acknowledging invitation to attend the Dáil, which invitation he stated he should decline for obvious reasons. He expressed his entire sympathy with the demand of Ireland for a hearing of her just Cause at the Congress of the Nations. The contents of the letter were ordered to be published.

MainHeading.Title: STANDING ORDERS.
MainHeading.P: The draft Standing Orders were approved of and ordered to be circulated to the members.

MainHeading.Title: SECRETARIAT.
MainHeading.P: It was decided that the appointment of Clerks to the House be left to the Speaker, and that they be paid at the rate of £2 2s. per day while the House is in session.

MainHeading.Title: PEACE CONFERENCE DELEGATES' SUBSTITUTES AND DELEGATES' STAFF.
MainHeading.P: A select Committee consisting of Sean O. hAodha, C. O Coileain, P. O Maille, R.C. Barton, and Sean T. O'Kelly was appointed to consider and report on the above.

MainHeading.Title: SUBSTITUTE MEMBERS FOR MEMBERS IN JAIL.
MainHeading.P: It was decided that the Executive of the Dáil should first consider the question and then report to the Dáil.

MainHeading.Title: DAIL MINISTRY.
MainHeading.P: CATHAL BRUGHA was appointed President of the Ministry pro. tem.

The Meeting here adjourned in order to enable the President to submit the names of the officers of the Ministry in accordance with Article 2 (Clause b.) of the Constitution. On resuming, the President submitted, and the Dáil approved, of the following nominations to the Ministry:—
(The Teachta from East Kerry, P. BEASLAI, dissented in regard to the Finance Minister.)

MainHeading.Title: WHIPS.
MainHeading.P: Official Whips were not considered necessary.

MainHeading.Title: VOTE OF SUPPLY.
MainHeading.P: A vote of credit, empowering the Finance Minister to raise £2,000 for necessary expenses, was carried on the motion of the Teachta from St. Stephen's Green (Ald. Kelly) seconded by the Teachta from Donegal North (Jos. O'Doherty).

MainHeading.Title: ELECTION OF SPEAKER AND DEPUTY SPEAKER.
MainHeading.P: SEAN T. O'KELLY was selected Speaker of the House. The appointment of Deputy Speaker was deferred to next meeting.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLICATION.
MainHeading.P: It was decided to announce in Irish that an Executive had been elected in accordance with the Constitution.
